Module JqueryGeneratorExt
In: slices/jquery/jquery_generator_ext.rb

Methods

avoid_conflicts!   get   post   post_and_run   when_document_ready  

Public Instance methods

avoid_conflicts!()

Gives control of the $ variable back to whichever library first implemented it. This helps to make sure that jQuery doesn‘t conflict with the $ object of other libraries

[Source]

   # File slices/jquery/jquery_generator_ext.rb, line 5
5:   def avoid_conflicts!
6:     self << "jQuery.noConflict();"
7:   end
get(url) {|:data| ...}

Makes a get request to the url and yields the data variable in which the contents of the request are stored. See Escahton.url_for_javascript for url options.

[Source]

    # File slices/jquery/jquery_generator_ext.rb, line 24
24:   def get(url)
25:     self << "jQuery.get(#{Eschaton.url_for_javascript(url)}, function(data) {"
26:     yield :data
27:     self <<  "});"    
28:   end
post(options) {|:data if block_given?| ...}

Performs an http post using either the form or the params to the given url.

Options:

  • url - Required. The url to post to, see Escahton.url_for_javascript for supported options.
  • form - Optional. The id of the form to post.
  • params - Optional. Parameters to post
  • eval_response - Optional. Indicates if the response of the post should be evaled and executed client side.

[Source]

    # File slices/jquery/jquery_generator_ext.rb, line 37
37:   def post(options)
38:     options.assert_valid_keys :url, :form, :params, :eval_response
39:     options.default! :form => nil, :params => {}, :eval_response => false
40: 
41:     if Eschaton.current_view.protect_against_forgery?
42:       options[:url][:authenticity_token] = Eschaton.current_view.form_authenticity_token
43:     end
44: 
45:     form_fields = if options[:form]
46:                     "jQuery('##{options[:form]}').serialize()"
47:                   else
48:                     options[:params].to_js
49:                   end
50: 
51:     url = Eschaton.url_for_javascript(options[:url])
52:     self << "jQuery.post(#{url}, #{form_fields}, function(data) {"
53: 
54:     yield :data if block_given?
55: 
56:     self.eval(:data) if options[:eval_response]
57:     
58:     self <<  "});"    
59:   end
post_and_run(options)

Performs an http post and evaluates the response as javascript. Supports the same options as post.

[Source]

    # File slices/jquery/jquery_generator_ext.rb, line 62
62:   def post_and_run(options)
63:     options[:eval_response] = true
64: 
65:     self.post options
66:   end
when_document_ready() {|self| ...}

Any script that is added within the block will execute when the document is ready. 

 when_document_ready do
   script << "var i = 1;"
   script << "alert(i);"
   script.alert('hello world!')
 end

[Source]

    # File slices/jquery/jquery_generator_ext.rb, line 16
16:   def when_document_ready
17:     self << "jQuery(document).ready(function() {"
18:     yield self
19:     self << "})"
20:   end

[Validate]
